page.title: 17INTERVIEW WITH A LOCAL
page.content: Mr. Curtis has lived here for 56 years. He moved here in November 1928 with his as a signalman.He lived in Ludgershall before moving into the area.He likes Watchfield a lot and would not like it to be changed in any way.Mr.Curtis approves of the bypass and said it made Watchfield less crowded.He also said it made the old A420 less dangerous than before.Mr. Curtis said that the College on the other side of the road has changed the atmosphere in a way that the population has increased a lot.If he had a choice of living anywhere else he said he would stay in Watchfield. He said that the only major disaster in Watchfield was before he was born when there were two murders and one attempted murder.The killer was caught and hanged in Reading in 1893.
